patterns: Can you tell me about sustainability?
What does it mean to live sustainably?
responses: It involves making choices that reduce your environmental impact.
It is about meeting our own needs without compromising the ability of future generations to meet theirs.
It means reducing your carbon footprint and conserving resources.

patterns: Can you tell me about recycling?
responses: Common recyclables include paper, cardboard, glass, metal, and certain plastics.
To recycle effectively, clean and separate your recyclables according to local guidelines.
Not all plastics are recyclable. Check for the recycling symbol and number on the item.
By using energy-efficient appliances and turning off lights when not in use.
Consider using renewable energy sources such as solar or wind power.
Insulating your home can also help reduce energy consumption.
To conserve water, fix leaks, install water-efficient fixtures, and take shorter showers.
Collect rainwater for gardening and use drought-resistant plants in your landscaping.
Only run dishwashers and washing machines with full loads.
